ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Newbie bard leaves Kunark (was Newbie bard race to  12 )
ygData.msgSnippet: Lake of Ill Omen has mobs ranging from 1st level all the way to the low 40 s.   I would not be surprised if someone could level from 1 to 50 with out ever
ygData.messageBody:
Lake of Ill Omen has mobs ranging from 1st level all the way to the low
40's. I would not be surprised if someone could level from 1 to 50 with
out ever leaving this zone. :) And for the mid levels teens to high 20's I
do not think there is a better zone in the game.

To find mobs that will be tasty in the low to mid teens you need to go the
NE shore of the lake. Going NE from here is a wide valley that leads to
Cabilis. As you get closer to Cabilis the mob levels drop, till you get to
the guards then they get high real fast ;) There is a nice camp in the
valley of Forsaken Iksar that would be perfect for your level range (loc
3250, -1800). Here is a map
(http://www.tapr.org/~OutridersKarana/kunark/illomen.html) to help you find
your way.

Rokenn

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Elijah Meeker [mailto:emeeker@...]
> Sent: Wednesday, July 12, 2000 7:36 AM
> To: 'eqbards@egroups.com'
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] Newbie bard leaves Kunark (was Newbie bard race
> to 12 )
>
>
>
> > Have you tried the Lake of Ill Omen yet?
>
> I peeked in there last night, everything was red and yellow,
> I decided it
> would be best to go back after a few levels.
>
> As I ran, with one mob behind me and one still fighting
> > my husband (who was doing fine with the one) I remembered some
> > discussions about crowd control and running circles with mobs in
> > tow. So I made sure I had my mandolin equipped and made a
> wide turn
> > back while healing myself. Once the battle was done I
> deposited the
> > extra mob back where we were originally fighting and we
> finished him
> > off. So much better getting exp on the 2 mobs than zoning.
>
> "Heal Kiting" rocks :o) I used it all the time on the south
> shore of Eask
> karana against Gnoll Reavers. Without SoW it goes like this:
>
> Selos, autorun
> Arm drum to get distance
> switch to lute
> alternate selos and hymn
>
> keep them close enough to keep chasing you, I *think* their
> healing rate is
> the combat one when chasing not the faster non-combat rate.
>
> Tsengu
>
>
> [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
>
